definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: It depends on detection equipment and Apparatus for the sensitivity and stability.
sentences.chinese: 它取決於檢測設備和抓拍設備的靈敏度和穩定性。

sentences.english: And two deer were caught on tape after breaking into a New Haven donut shop.
sentences.chinese: 兩隻鹿闖進一間新天堂甜甜圈的時候被抓拍到了。

sentences.english: This picture captures the rainbow at its brightest right before the rain started
sentences.chinese: 這張照片抓拍了雨前的最美的彩虹。

sentences.english: A wild baby snow leopard has been caught on camera.
sentences.chinese: 山地攝影機抓拍到一隻野生幼年雪豹的影像。

sentences.english: The winning photo captures the ferocity of a spring-time fight between two cock pheasants.
sentences.chinese: 獲獎照片抓拍到兩隻雄雉在春季搏鬥的激烈場面。

sentences.english: The Associated Press sent a photographer to capture the chicken's many moods.
sentences.chinese: 美聯社則派了一名攝影記者前來抓拍小雞的各種表情。

sentences.english: You can find the perfect timing by the photographers in taking these photos of the birds in action.
sentences.chinese: 看看這些攝影師在鳥類行動時的完美抓拍。

sentences.english: Recently the team captured video of the bats catching live fish.
sentences.chinese: 最近這個小組抓拍到了此種蝙蝠捕食活魚的視頻。

sentences.english: I think I'm trying to capture pictures of people that help others see what they're about.
sentences.chinese: 我嘗試抓拍一些有助於別人瞭解被拍者的照片。

sentences.english: Here is a picture that I snapped with my iPhone.
sentences.chinese: 這是我用iPhone抓拍的一張照片。

sentences.english: I managed to make two photos of this and the bird flew away with the rabbit in its bill.
sentences.chinese: 我抓拍了兩張之後蒼鷺就飛走了，兔子還含在它嘴裏。

definition: traffic camera/speed camera/closed-circuit TV police surveillance
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
to break the rules/to violate regulations
to exceed the speed limit/to speed/high-speed
to show consideration for (others)/to yield to (another vehicle etc)/courtesy/comity
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to deduct marks (when grading school work)/to have marks deducted/penalty points/to lose points for a penalty or error
to take a picture or video of oneself/to take a selfie/selfie
to document on film the course of events/to follow sb with a camera
